description.narrative: In alignement with the MOEVT ZEDP II, which is the national strategic plan for the education sector in Zanzibar, priority areas has been • Expanding Access to Education, with a Particular Focus on Primary Education • Capacity Building for Staff at the Ministry of Education and Vocational Training (MoEVT) • Strengthening of Monitoring, Evaluation and Assessment (MEA), under which was the: - Development of MOEVT’s website, and - Financial Management Reform

Stöd till Zanzibars utbildningssektor för genomförandet av Zanzibars strategiska plan för undervisning, ZEDP, under tiden juni 2010 tom. juni 2013. Stödet framförallt inriktat på kapacitetsutveckling och byggande av klassrum.

Support to Zanzibar's education sector for implementation of the Zanzibar Education Development Programme, ZEDP, from June 2010 through June 2013. The main parts of the support is aimed for capacity building and classroom construction.

tag.narrative: 4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The main results to attribute the support are related to access to education - school/classroom construction, capacity building of staff at MoEVT and strengthening of the MEA system at MoEVT. Below follows a summary. Access to education has improved by the fee free education implemented in Zanzibar. The big number of enrollment of children in lower grades has reduced the number of children out of school. The increasing population is a mayor challenge. The pupils’ classroom ratio stand at 67 (in 2017), above the set standard of 45. More than 20 additional children in each classroom, than planned for. The support trough Sida, the last 10 years, to improve by completion of classrooms has been important. In only 2017/18 the government planned to complete 200 classrooms out of more than the 285 existing classrooms. This has contributed to the improvment of access to education, with a particular focus on primary education. The ministry has applied an interesting model of completion of classrooms, contructed by the communites, whith Sida support. The completion of classrooms has included the finalization of the constrution such as the roof and provision of furnitures. Local artisans were trained to work on the construction of the classrooms and to improve the learning environment. The library in Pemba was finished and improved, in addition to establish a reading program under the library services, for childrenin the area. The increasing population of children in need of education access and quality is the main challenge. The model the ministry has applied with Sida fund has contributed to a different approach and involvement of the community. The need of continous rehabilitation of classrooms to maintain its quality is a key challenge. Capacity building - a key area to improve internal mangement, the education management systems, the capacity to analyze and improve the ability to plan and follow-up access to and quality education. Some key staff members from the ministry have been trained sucessfully and provided new and important knowledge to the ministry. Some staff have been trained are now in positions of leadership in the Ministry. It has been instrumental in ensuring that the national strategic plan for the education sector of Zanzibar was developed in a timely manner and disseminated. However, the ministry has recognized the challenges with the organisational structure and culture. Trained focal points for improved monitoring are not able to support and deliver their expertise to people and situations where it is needed. Strengthening the EMIS has been one of the primary reason for the multiple delays in the program. The consultant firm employed to make the system user-friendly was not able to work to the satisfaction of the Ministry and time was needed to seek other solutions. Unplanned activites have funded through the Sector Support, approved by Sida, such as working on the planning for the new strategic plan, ZEDP II, however according to the ministry the process was not well planned and not efficently executed, and caused delays.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
